content.statement: proc-022-completion-duplex is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding proc-022-completion-duplex helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of proc-022-completion-duplex include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of proc-022-completion-duplex.

definitions_glossary.peak_systolic_velocity: Maximum velocity of blood flow during systole, measured in cm/s
definitions_glossary.velocity_ratio: PSV at stenosis divided by PSV in adjacent normal segment
definitions_glossary.b_mode: Brightness mode ultrasound showing two-dimensional grayscale image
definitions_glossary.doppler_shift: Frequency change of reflected sound waves used to calculate velocity
definitions_glossary.color_flow: Ultrasound mode showing direction and relative velocity of blood flow

indications: When contrast is contraindicated (allergy, renal failure)
Surgeon preference for functional velocity data
contraindications: Deep reconstructions not accessible with ultrasound
Aortic surgery (requires angiography for adequate visualization)
Critically unstable patient requiring rapid closure
No available ultrasound equipment or expertise

scanning_protocol: Entire graft body (look for stenosis, twist, kink)

b_mode_findings.normal: Smooth wall, adequate diameter, no filling defects
b_mode_findings.abnormal: Wall thickening, intimal flap, diameter stenosis, thrombus

complications.prevention: Use hemodynamic criteria, not just B-mode appearance

definition.@value: Intraoperative ultrasound imaging combining B-mode and Doppler to assess vascular reconstructions for technical errors

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the technique of completion duplex ultrasound
Interpret velocity criteria for hemodynamically significant stenosis
Compare duplex to angiography for intraoperative assessment
Perform intraoperative duplex with proper technique
clinical_pearls: PSV >180 cm/s or ratio >2.0 = significant stenosis - this is your threshold
Duplex is ideal for vein grafts - you can see the whole graft and measure velocities
The velocity ratio is more reliable than absolute PSV for detecting stenosis
Completion duplex establishes a baseline for postoperative surveillance
If duplex and clinical exam disagree, get an angiogram to settle it

medicalCode.description: Duplex scan of arterial inflow and venous outflow for preoperative assessment
